channel.title: Teen stabbing is ruled justified
channel.description:
http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/state/stand-your-ground-defense-upheld-in-murder-charge-against-jorge-saavedra-in-stabbing-death-of-teen
NAPLES, Fla. -- A 15-year-old who fatally stabbed his school mate will no longer face criminal prosecution. A judge’s ruling, made public Tuesday, granted a motion to dismiss the second-degree murder charge against Jorge Saavedra in the death of 16-year-old Dylan Nuno on the grounds that he acted in self-defense under Florida’s “Stand Your Ground” law. The State Attorney’s Office has indicated that it will not appeal the ruling.
I found this interesting, I actually agree with the outcome of the case. If the events actually played out the way the article makes them sound, I don't see why it wasn't justified

item.title: Teen stabbing is ruled justified
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:7, topic:428117”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=530804.msg3877176#msg3877176 date=1325755917]

It looks like all parties got their just deserts. I’m glad that some parts of the world still have sensible self-defense laws.

Come on, we’ve all been bullied before. Besides, stabbing someone 12 times shows it was an act of rage, not self-defense.
[/quote]
Fight or flight response, and he chose to fight. Overcompensation was bound to happen if his adrenaline was pumping.
Also, a punch to the back of the head is at the extreme end of the bullying spectrum.[/quote]

If anything this makes him more dangerous because he’s unable to control himself in high stress situations. I realise it’s dificult but I’d expect most people to be able to withhold themselves enough to disable the assailant and then use some of that adrenaline to make a run for it.

You can defend these type of people but clearly this “overcompensation” is what can make a murderer. If his wife cheated on him in 20 years time whose to say he wont react with the same anger and vengeance.

I cannot agree with this sentence.

EDIT: *LACK of sentence, ha

Read full topic

item.title: Teen stabbing is ruled justified
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:5, topic:428117”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=530804.msg3877152#msg3877152 date=1325752845]
It looks like all parties got their just deserts. I’m glad that some parts of the world still have sensible self-defense laws.
[/quote]

Come on, we’ve all been bullied before. Besides, stabbing someone 12 times shows it was an act of rage, not self-defense.[/quote]
Fight or flight response, and he chose to fight. Overcompensation was bound to happen if his adrenaline was pumping.
Also, a punch to the back of the head is at the extreme end of the bullying spectrum.

Read full topic

item.title: Teen stabbing is ruled justified
item.dc:creator: @Phillipe Phillipé
item.description:
@Phillipe wrote:

I heard a good way of self defence is stabbing someone 12 times, while you’re at it you might aswell roll their corpse up in a wire fence with some cinderblocks and throw them in a river.

Read full topic

item.title: Teen stabbing is ruled justified
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Reyx, you don’t want to complicate things, just let it be known that death can be a result for even the most petty crimes. Its a good demotivator.

Read full topic

item.title: Teen stabbing is ruled justified
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Still, stabbing to kill is never the goal. 12 times sounds Saavedra was continually using a forceful, rapid hit. 2-3 stabs to the leg or lower chest would’ve been sufficient in the wounding of Dylan, preventing him from further action.

Read full topic
